item.title: 上海振华否认对美国港口构成网络安全风险
item.description: 上海振华重工（ZPMC）周日表示，在美国国会委员会质疑这家中国国有企业为运往美国的起重机所做的工作之后，该公司的起重机不会构成网络安全威胁。【原文：Shanghai Zhenhua Heavy Industries (ZPMC) said on Sunday its cranes do not pose a cybersecurity threat, after U.S. congressional committees questioned the Chinese state-owned company's work on cranes bound for the United States.】

item.title: 阿美石油公司首席执行官认为中国需求健康，期待更多投资
item.description: 沙特阿美首席执行官阿明-纳赛尔（Amin Nasser）周日表示，该石油巨头正在寻找进一步投资中国的机会，他说中国的石油需求强劲且不断增长。【原文：Saudi Aramco Chief Executive Amin Nasser said on Sunday the oil giant was looking at further opportunities to invest in China, where he said oil demand was robust and growing.】

item.title: 华尔街巨头云集，金融博物馆寻找安身之所
item.description: 上周，金融业重量级人物齐聚纽约，为失去华尔街标志性地址的金融博物馆筹集资金。【原文：Financial industry heavyweights convened in New York last week to raise funds for a finance museum that has lost its iconic Wall Street address.】

item.title: 汉莎航空空乘人员将于周二和周三罢工
item.description: 汉莎航空机舱乘务员工会号召其成员在周二和周三举行汉莎航空和短途航空公司 CityLine 的罢工，以满足他们对更高薪酬的要求。【原文：Lufthansa's cabin crew union has called on its members to strike at Lufthansa and short-haul carrier CityLine on Tuesday and Wednesday to press their demands for higher pay.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，Kering 和 EssilorLuxottica 可能成为意大利 Marcolin 公司的收购者
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周六报道，古驰（Gucci）的所有者开云集团（Kering）和雷朋（Ray-Ban）的母公司依视路（EssilorLuxottica）是意大利眼镜制造商马科林（Marcolin）的追求者之一。【原文：Gucci-owner Kering and Ray-Ban parent EssilorLuxottica are among the suitors for Italian eyewear manufacturer Marcolin, the Financial Times reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，开云集团（Kering）和依视路集团（EssilorLuxottica）是眼镜制造商 Marcolin 的收购者之一
item.description: 据《金融时报》周六报道，开云集团（Kering）和依视路（EssilorLuxottica）是汤姆-福特（Tom Ford）流行眼镜系列的意大利制造商马科林（Marcolin）的追求者之一。【原文：Kering and EssilorLuxottica are among suitors for Marcolin, the Italian manufacturer of Tom Ford’s popular eyewear line, the Financial Times reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 赣锋锂业称中国锂市场将长期保持上升趋势
item.description: 中国主要的锂电池金属供应商赣锋锂业董事长表示，锂电池金属的价格将长期保持上升趋势，中国的锂产业将从价格稳定中受益。【原文：China's lithium industry would benefit from a stabilisation of prices of the battery metal, which is set for a long-term uptrend, said the chairman of Ganfeng Lithium, a major Chinese supplier of the battery metal.】

item.title: 中国称总体就业压力尚未缓解
item.description: 中国人力资源部部长周六表示，中国仍面临结构性就业问题，就业压力并未缓解，经济增速放缓的中国正准备迎接 2024 年大学毕业生人数再创新高。【原文：China still faces structural employment issues and the pressure on jobs has not eased, the country's human resources minister said on Saturday, as the slowing economy braces for another record number of college graduates in 2024.】

item.title: 马斯克称 X 的长视频很快将在智能电视上播放
item.description: 据《财富》杂志报道，社交网络 X 计划下周为亚马逊和三星用户推出一款电视应用程序，亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）表示，长视频很快就能在智能电视上播放。【原文：Long-form videos will soon be available on smart televisions, billionaire Elon Musk said, after Fortune magazine reported that social network X planned to launch next week a TV app for Amazon and Samsung users.】

item.title: 美国法官阻止美国劳工委员会涉及合同工和特许经营工人的规定
item.description: 德克萨斯州的一名联邦法官周五驳回了美国全国劳资关系委员会（NLRB）一项受到主要商业团体质疑的规定，该规定将许多公司视为某些合同工和特许经营工人的雇主，并要求他们与代表这些工人的工会进行谈判。【原文：A federal judge in Texas on Friday struck down a U.S. National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) rule challenged by major business groups that would treat many companies as employers of certain contract and franchise workers and require them to bargain with unions representing them.】

item.title: 波音称未发现有关拆除 737 MAX 9 关键部件的文件
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一封信，波音公司周五表示，它认为在生产737 MAX 9过程中，涉及一个关键部件的打开和关闭的必要文件从未创建。【原文：Boeing said on Friday it believes required documents involving the opening and closing of a key part during production of a 737 MAX 9 that failed during a mid-air emergency were never created, according to a letter seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社：美国考虑将 CXMT 列入黑名单，以遏制中国芯片技术的进步
item.description: 彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）周五称，美国正在权衡对包括芯片制造商长鑫存储科技公司（ChangXin Memory Technologies）在内的几家中国科技公司实施制裁，以进一步限制中国先进半导体的发展。【原文：The United States is weighing sanctions on several Chinese tech companies, including chipmaker ChangXin Memory Technologies, in a bid to further restrain China's development of advanced semiconductors, Bloomberg News said on Friday.】

item.title: 中国 2 月居民消费价格同比上涨 0.7
item.description: 尽管生产者价格下降，但中国的消费者价格六个月来首次上涨，为这个面临需求疲软、房地产低迷和地方政府债务高企的世界第二大经济体带来了一些喘息的机会。【原文：China's consumer prices rose for the first time in six months, providing some reprieve for the world's second-biggest economy, which faces sluggish demand, a property slump and high local government debt, although producer prices dropped.】

item.title: 葡萄酒供应过剩，澳大利亚农民砍掉数百万株葡萄树
item.description: 澳大利亚有数百万株葡萄树被毁，还有数千万株葡萄树必须拔除，以控制过量生产，因为过量生产压低了葡萄价格，威胁到种植者和葡萄酒酿造者的生计。【原文：Millions of vines are being destroyed in Australia and tens of millions more must be pulled up to rein in overproduction that has crushed grape prices and threatens the livelihoods of growers and wine makers.】

item.title: 陷入困境的纽约银行宣布新任首席执行官奥廷的基本工资
item.description: 纽约社区银行（New York Community Bancorp）周五表示，新任首席执行官约瑟夫-奥廷（Joseph Otting）将获得 125 万美元的基本年薪，并从 3 月 6 日起获得一次性期权，可购买 1500 万股公司普通股。【原文：New York Community Bancorp said on Friday incoming CEO Joseph Otting will receive an annual base salary of $1.25 million and as of March 6 received a one-time option to acquire 15 million shares of the company's common stock.】

item.title: Sam Altman 将与三位新董事重返 OpenAI 董事会
item.description: 世界上最著名的人工智能公司 OpenAI 周五表示，OpenAI 首席执行官山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）将与三名新董事一起重返 ChatGPT 制造商的董事会。【原文：OpenAI Chief Executive Sam Altman will return to the ChatGPT-maker's board along with three new directors, the world's most prominent artificial intelligence company said on Friday.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 白宫争夺战成为华尔街关注焦点
item.description: 专注于盈利和货币政策的投资者开始考虑今年可能左右市场的另一个变量：2024 年美国总统大选。【原文：Investors fixated on earnings and monetary policy are starting to factor in another variable that could sway markets this year: the 2024 U.S. presidential election.】

item.title: 美国司法部称，ByteDance TikTok 撤资法案将赋予政府更有力的法律地位
item.description: 美国司法部告诉国会，如果立法者命令中国字节跳动公司剥离 TikTok，而不是简单地禁止这款短视频应用，政府将处于更有利的法律地位。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department told Congress the government would be in a stronger legal position if lawmakers ordered China's ByteDance to divest TikTok rather than simply banning the short video app.】

item.title: FDA 批准诺和诺德的 Wegovy 用于降低心脏病发作风险
item.description: 丹麦制药商诺和诺德公司周五表示，美国食品和药物管理局已批准该公司生产的Wegovy用于降低非糖尿病的超重或肥胖成年人中风和心脏病发作的风险。【原文：The U.S. FDA has approved Novo Nordisk's Wegovy for use in lowering the risk of stroke and heart attack in overweight or obese adults who are not diabetic, the Danish drugmaker said on Friday.】

item.title: 苹果恢复 Epic Games 开发者账户
item.description: 堡垒之夜》（Fortnite）游戏制造商苹果公司周五表示，已经恢复了 Epic Games 的开发者账户，两天前苹果曾阻止该公司在欧洲的 iPhone 和 iPad 上推出自己的在线市场。【原文：Apple has reinstated Epic Games' developer account, the Fortnite game maker said on Friday, two days after it had blocked the company from launching its own online marketplace on iPhones and iPads in Europe.】

item.title: 好市多股价因季度收入不及预期而创下近两年来最差表现
item.description: 好市多股价周五下跌超过 7%，创下自 2022 年 5 月以来的最差表现，原因是这家会员制零售连锁店第二季度营收不及预期，并表示汽油价格下跌将带来负面影响。【原文：Costco's shares were down over 7% on Friday and set for its worst day since May 2022 after the membership-only retail chain missed second-quarter revenue expectations and signaled a negative impact from lower gasoline prices.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，台积电将为美国芯片厂赢得 50 多亿美元拨款
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五报道，全球最大的合约芯片制造商台湾积体电路制造股份有限公司（台积电）将获得美国政府超过 50 亿美元的联邦拨款，用于在亚利桑那州建立芯片制造厂。【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC) , the world's largest contract chipmaker, is set to win more than $5 billion in federal grants from the United States government for setting up a chipmaking plant in Arizona, Bloomberg News reported on Friday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，意大利正在敲定价值 33 亿美元的硅箱工厂交易
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的消息人士周五透露，意大利正在与半导体公司 Silicon Box 敲定一项由国家支持的交易条款，价值约 30 亿欧元（33 亿美元），用于在该国建设一个工业基地。【原文：Italy is finalising the terms of a state-backed deal with semiconductor firm Silicon Box worth around 3 billion euros ($3.3 billion) to build an industrial site in the country, a source familiar with the matter said on Friday.】

item.title: 高盛董事会成员杰西卡-乌尔将离职
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）周五表示，董事会成员杰西卡-乌尔（Jessica Uhl）将卸任，专心担任通用电气能源分拆公司 GE Vernova 的总裁。【原文：Goldman Sachs said on Friday that board member Jessica Uhl is stepping down to focus on her role as president of General Electric's energy spin-off GE Vernova.】

item.title: 特斯拉德国工厂将于下周重启，工会负责人表示
item.description: 特斯拉位于柏林附近的德国工厂自 3 月 5 日以来一直处于停工状态，原因是极左翼极端分子对附近的电力塔实施了纵火袭击，该工厂的工会负责人周五表示，工厂将于下周恢复运营。【原文：Tesla's German plant near Berlin, which has been down since March 5 because far-left extremists carried out an arson attack on a near-by power pylone, will resume operations next week, the head of the plant's works council said on Friday.】

item.title: 山姆-奥特曼的世界币公司在西班牙禁令后提起诉讼
item.description: 山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）的Worldcoin公司发言人周五表示，Worldcoin公司已对西班牙数据保护监管机构提起诉讼，以回应被禁止在西班牙开展业务一事。【原文：Sam Altman's Worldcoin has filed a lawsuit against the Spanish data protection regulator in response to being banned from operating in Spain, a spokesperson for Worldcoin said on Friday.】

item.title: 商业地产风险拖累纽约商业银行扭亏之路坎坷不平
item.description: 纽约社区银行的扭亏为盈可能需要很长时间，因为分析师预计该银行的利润仍将面临压力，原因是该银行努力提高商业房地产投资组合中潜在不良贷款的准备金。【原文：New York Community Bancorp's turnaround will likely take a long time as analysts expect profits to remain under pressure from the lender's efforts to boost reserves for potential bad loans in its commercial real estate portfolio.】

item.title: 欧盟《数字市场法》助力大型科技公司的小型竞争对手
item.description: 随着全球最大的科技公司为遵守欧盟具有里程碑意义的《数字市场法案》（Digital Markets Act）而对其核心在线服务进行改造，这些变化可能会给一些较小的竞争对手甚至同行带来竞争优势。【原文：As the world's biggest tech companies revamp their core online services to comply with the European Union's landmark Digital Markets Act, the changes could give some smaller rivals and even peers a competitive edge.】

item.title: Binance 必须面对投资者在美国就加密货币损失再次提起的诉讼
item.description: 联邦上诉法院周五重启了一起诉讼，投资者指控全球最大的加密货币交易所 Binance 违反美国证券法，出售未经注册的代币，导致代币价值大幅缩水。【原文：A federal appeals court on Friday revived a lawsuit where investors accused Binance, the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, of violating U.S. securities laws by selling unregistered tokens that lost much of their value.】

item.title: 英伟达即将超越苹果，成为市值第二高的公司
item.description: 英伟达（Nvidia）正紧随苹果公司之后，成为全球估值第二高的公司，因为投资者对这家半导体制造商爱不释手，其芯片为 ChatGPT 等流行的人工智能工具提供了动力。【原文：Nvidia is nipping at the heels of Apple to become the world's second-most-valuable company, as investors cannot get enough of the semiconductor maker whose chips power popular artificial intelligence tools such as ChatGPT.】
